intro: Pavetta gleniei var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers and hairy foliage. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or thickets. The leaves are usually ovate or elliptic in shape and have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs.
